intro: Eclipta turkica, commonly known as Turkish eclipta, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Eclipta turkica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
